summary: This is a legal memorandum filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, supporting a motion to strike references to 'Accuser-3' from the superseding indictment. The defense argues the allegations regarding Accuser-3 are irrelevant surplusage because they involve no alleged travel (a key element of the Mann Act charges) and the accuser was above the age of consent in England, and that the allegations are unduly prejudicial. The document outlines the defense's legal arguments against the inclusion of these allegations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiring to violate the Mann Act. Her defense team is filing this motion to strike allegations regarding Accuser-3 from the indictment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the individual with whom Maxwell allegedly conspired and whom the accusers were introduced to for sexual activity.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, a signatory on the memorandum from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser LLP, also signed the certificate of service.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

persons.name: Accuser-1
persons.context: Also referred to as Minor Victim-1. The individual who is the subject of the substantive Mann Act counts, allegedly enticed to travel from Florida to New York.

persons.name: Accuser-2
persons.context: Also referred to as Minor Victim-2. An individual mentioned in the indictment whose allegations are not the subject of this specific motion.

persons.name: Accuser-3
persons.context: Also referred to as Minor Victim-3. The central figure of this motion. The defense argues allegations about her (involving interactions in London, 1994-1995) should be stricken as irrelevant and prejudicial.

connections.description: Alleged by the government to have conspired to violate the Mann Act. The defense motion argues the alleged conduct with Accuser-3 does not further this conspiracy.
The indictment alleges Maxwell groomed and befriended Accuser-3, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage Epstein knowing sexual acts would occur.
The indictment alleges Epstein sexually abused Accuser-3 during massages that Maxwell facilitated.
The indictment alleges Maxwell enticed/caused Accuser-1 to travel from Florida to New York to engage in sexual activity with Epstein.
Cohen is listed as an attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, submitting this legal memorandum on her behalf.
Everdell is listed as an attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, submitting this legal memorandum on her behalf.

events.title: Alleged Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring to violate the Mann Act (Counts One-Four).

events.title: Alleged Interactions with Accuser-3 in London
events.description: The period when Maxwell allegedly groomed and befriended Accuser-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and arranged massages where sexual abuse allegedly occurred.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Strike Surplusage
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files this memorandum in support of a motion to strike all references to Accuser-3 from the superseding indictment.

locations: Southern District of New York (court jurisdiction)
Denver, Colorado (location of defense firm Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.)
keyFacts: The defense motion seeks to remove all allegations regarding 'Accuser-3' from the indictment, arguing they are irrelevant surplusage meant to prejudice the jury.
A core defense argument is that the Mann Act charges require allegations of travel, but there is no allegation that Accuser-3 ever traveled in interstate or foreign commerce.

The defense argues that during the alleged interactions (1994-1995), Accuser-3 was at or above the age of consent in England (16), and the indictment does not allege the activity was nonconsensual or violated English law.

The defense contends that allegations Accuser-3 was 'sexually abused' are inflammatory and prejudicial, and their inclusion is an attempt to circumvent Federal Rule of Evidence 404(b) governing 'other acts' evidence.

The motion reveals that Accuser-3 was born in March 1977, meaning she turned 25 in March 2002, which the defense argues makes any prosecution for conduct involving her time-barred under the statute of limitations in effect at the time.
